revised_title: An Exploration of the Tubera Terrae, or Truffles, Found in Northamptonshire
tldr: This article discusses the discovery of truffles, or Tubera Terrae, in Northamptonshire, England. The author, Tancred Robinson, describes their appearance, smell, and taste, as well as their history and uses in various cuisines. He also speculates about their origin and possible connection to certain plants. The author mentions that truffles are found after thunderstorms and are most tender in the spring.
